title: Arsenal striker Lucas Perez wants Arsene Wenger to stay at the club despite his lack of first-team opportunities
text:
Perez is keen to impress Wenger and win back his place (Photo: Getty Images Europe)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Arsenal striker Lucas Perez expects Arsene Wenger to sign a new contract and insists he has a ‘very good relationship’ with the Gunners boss despite his lack of first-team chances. 
Wenger’s future continues to dominate the headlines and the latest reports suggest he is finally set to make a decision following the big game against Manchester City this weekend. 
The Arsenal boss has suffered a nightmare few weeks after seeing his team suffer an embarrassing Champions League defeat against Bayern Munich and has seen his side lose four of their last five Premier League games including a 3-1 defeat against West Brom. Perez has only started two Premier League games for the Gunners (Photo: Getty) 
Perez joined the north London club from Deportivo La Coruna last summer for £17.1million, but has failed to make any impact and has only started two Premier League games. 
But the Spanish forward is adamant he is still happy at Arsenal and feels Wenger is the best man to carry the club forward. 
Perez, speaking on Radio Marca, said: "Although I'm not a starter, I have a very good relationship with Wenger. He is an icon and I think he is going to continue Perez expects Wenger to sign a new deal (Photo: REUTERS) 
"People respect him. His relationship with the players is very good and he has been here 20 years. 
"I would like him to continue but that's his decision. He has not communicated his decision to the team or the club yet." 
Despite his lack of first-team starts, Perez has still managed an impressive record in front of goal scoring seven goals and registering five assists during his 21 appearances for the club. Perez faces a big battle with the likes of Alexis Sanchez (Photo: Getty) 
The 28-year-old faces stiff competition from the likes of Alexis Sanchez, Theo Walcott, Olivier Giroud and Danny Welbeck, but will continue to fight hard to win back his place in the team. 
Perez added: "A team like Arsenal has very good players, especially in attack. The coach can only choose 11 and the only thing I can do is make the most of the chances I'm given. 
"Whenever I've played, I've done well and that gives me confidence. I have to be patient and continue to fight. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
